definitions.definition: respond or behave in a particular way in response to something.
examples: he reacted angrily to the news of his dismissal
synonyms: answer "how would he react if she told him the truth?"rebel against
rise up against "she reacted against the new regulations"

definitions.definition: respond with hostility, opposition, or a contrary course of action to.
examples: they reacted against the elite art music of their time

definitions.definition: (of a person) suffer from adverse physiological effects after ingesting, breathing, or touching a substance.
examples: many babies react to soy-based formulas

definitions.definition: interact and undergo a chemical or physical change.
examples: the sulfur in the coal reacts with the limestone during combustion

definitions.definition: cause (a substance) to undergo a change by interacting with another substance.
(of stock prices) fall or rise in reaction to events, developments, etc.
